result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard B Hron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. 
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM 22CF23/22CF137 Defendant Richard B Hron in court.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Richard B Hron for case 22CF23. Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Richard B. Hron for case 22CF137. Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights, charges and penalties. Court takes recess. Case recalled at 10:38. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1 in case 22CF23 and a plea of no contest to count 1 in case 22CF137. Counts 2 and 3 in case 22CF23 are DRI; count 2 in case 22CF137 is DRI. Court accepts pleas, and finds defendant guilty of count 1 in case 22CF23, and count 1 in case 22CF137. Sentencing arguments are given. Defendant gives statement. Court heard and imposes the following sentence;
**w/held sentence; 2 years probation w/ the following conditions -
- AODA assessment & follow through w/ recommended treatment
    - Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court. 
- No controlled substances w/out a valid prescription
- Do not be in the presence of anyone possessing controlled substances. 
- absolute sobriety
- court costs
- DNA/surcharge
- no firearms
- no voting rights
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard B Hron appeared by video.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Richard B Hron. Review of info is waived; not guilty pleas entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter from Atty Van Dam - APPROVED

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:30 AM Defendant Richard B Hron in court with attorney Becky N Van Dam.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:34 AM - 22CF23 & 21CM280 - Defendant, Richard B Hron in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petition filed in CF case. Court notes defendant also has RD on 21CM280; Court also calls that case. Discussion held. Defendant wants counsel in CF case only. Court appoints Atty Becky Van Dam at rate of $25/wk comm 3/4 through wage assignment. Defendant wants to accept agreement in CM case. Court takes break to allow defendant to complete paperwork for CM plea.
Review hearing on February 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
